com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.products.b: Your opponents will soon find themselves in troubled waters with the Blue Assault theme deck, especially when you unleash Galvantula! Its Electroweb attack is sure to leave them in sticky situations, and its Leech Life attack will keep your own Pokémon going strong! Use Basculin's Crunch attack to leave your opponent's Pokémon high and dry while Professor Juniper brings you calm waters. Will you be able to batter the opposition with the Blue Assault theme deck?

Watch foes feel the heat as White Kyurem sets your game ablaze in the Cold Fire theme deck! Send opponents on a slippery downward spiral with Samurott's Destructive Whirlpool attack, and run rings around them as they try to fend off Darmanitan's ferocious Damage Counterpunch attack. And, with Delibird, Delcatty, and Dunsparce delivering you deck-searching delights to drive the flames ever higher, your opponents will be going out…but not in a blaze of glory!

Mewtwo and Darkrai go head to head in the new Pokémon TCG Battle Arena Decks! These two 60-card decks are ready to play right away, with powerful cards and winning strategies worthy of an ace Trainer! Each deck is led by an exceptional Pokémon-EX and includes 10 foil cards. Let the battle begin!
Battle Arena Decks: Mewtwo vs. Darkrai

You'll use every trick under the sun to defeat your opponent when you play the Daybreak theme deck! The versatile Sludge Pokémon Muk both inflicts Special Conditions on your opponent's Pokémon and then adds on damage to those already affected. And when the Sun Pokémon Espeon begins to move damage counters from your Pokémon across the battlefield to your opponent's Pokémon, it will dawn on your opponent just how versatile your Daybreak deck really is!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a set of 9 Dewford themed promo cards and 8 basic Fighting Energy for you to enjoy or trade!

When dragons snarl, opponents fall! With the DragonSnarl theme deck, Pokémon like Skuntank, Golurk, and Gothitelle lead the charge and pave the way for your powerhouse Dragon-type Pokémon, Hydreigon, to roar into battle! As the Brutal Pokémon brings its aggressive combination of healing and devastating attacks to combat, your opponents will hear their defeat because they hear your dragons snarl!

Foes must make way for the mighty Mach Pokémon Garchomp or quickly learn a furious lesson! But time and tide wait for no Pokémon, and your opponents will have much to fear before that terrible arrival: Walrein will bring watery doom, speedily delivering wave after wave of Aurora Beam and Ice Entomb attacks…and there will be no respite when Marowak gets in on the action with its heavy-hitting Vortex Chop! With nowhere to run and no time to catch breath, can anyone match the dragons' speed?

Attack after devastating attack, you'll drive your opponents to the edge of defeat when you play the Explosive Edge theme deck! With Reshiram's fiery Blue Flare attack and Beartic's powerful Ambush attack, you'll blast your opponent's Pokémon turn after turn. And when Chandelure and Arcanine add even more cutting-edge attacks to your battles, you can expect every victory to be exceptional!

Dazzle your opponents with the Fast Daze theme deck! With its low-cost attacks and no Retreat Cost, Accelgor can get in and out of battle in the blink of an eye! Volcarona's Fiery Dance powers up your best attacks with blazing speed, and Lilligant's healing touch can get your quickest fighters back into the fray! You could be on the fast track to success!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a set of 9 Fortree themed promo cards and 8 basic Fairy Energy for you to enjoy or trade!

Freeze your foes with fear when you play the Frost Ray theme deck! Use Glaceon's Icy Wind attack to send opposing Pokémon into a cold, deep sleep, and Vanilluxe's powerful ChillMAX attack to let them know they're in for a rude awakening! You'll command the battlefield with superior speed using Glaceon's Freeze Zone Ability, and help keep the Energy flowing with Electrode's Magnetic Draw. Then, as you call Team Plasma Pokémon and Trainer cards from the discard pile with Raticate's Transfer Junk attack, your opponents will know anyone unwary enough to challenge you will be put on ice!

Send in the cavalry with the Furious Knights theme deck! Quick hitters like Emolga give you time to marshal your forces, and the slow and sturdy Escavalier can dish out the damage while protecting itself. Plus, Druddigon's Rough Skin Ability will make your opponent think twice about attacking! In a furious battle, victory could be yours!

Play the Green Tornado theme deck to blow away the opposition while sheltering your own Pokémon with Serperior's Leaf Storm attack! Then, bring Sawsbuck into the action and overwhelm your opponent's Pokémon with its "the greener, the meaner" Nature Power attack! And if your opponents can weather the storm with tough Pokémon, let them ride it out in peaceful slumbers with Musharna's Hypnotic Ray attack! With the Green Tornado theme deck, will you whirl your way to victory?

The Legendary Pokémon Groudon-EX leads the way in the Earthshaker theme deck, a Fighting-type deck with some serious punch! When the ground splits open in a Massive Rend, will your opponents be able to recover?

At last, three great Pokémon-EX from the highest heights and strange new worlds! Choose the sky-high swiftness of Rayquaza-EX, the soaring speed of Latios-EX, or the mystical fury of Hoopa-EX in the Pokémon Trading Card Game: Powers Beyond Tin! Each of these rugged tins contains a Legendary or Mythical Pokémon-EX for your collection, so make friends with one of these powerful Pokémon today!

Feel the chill as Black Kyurem takes center stage in the electrifying Ice Shock theme deck! Foes have no time to stop and stare as Black Kyurem unleashes its electrifying Flash Freeze attack, and with Jellicent's Stickiness Ability, they won't even be able to run and hide! The jolts continue as Lopunny takes time out from healing to drive the Defending Pokémon back to the Bench, helping Electivire blow your opponents' fuses as it delivers punishing attacks to Benched Pokémon. Can those who stand in your way avoid the blackout?

At last, three great Pokémon-EX from the highest heights and strange new worlds! Choose the sky-high swiftness of Rayquaza-EX, the soaring speed of Latios-EX, or the mystical fury of Hoopa-EX in the Pokémon Trading Card Game: Powers Beyond Tin! Each of these rugged tins contains a Legendary or Mythical Pokémon-EX for your collection, so make friends with one of these powerful Pokémon today!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a set of 9 Lavaridge themed promo cards and 8 basic Fire Energy for you to enjoy or trade!
Letterman's Event Jacket & Play! Pokémon Cap
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a set of 9 Mauville themed promo cards and 8 basic Lightning Energy for you to enjoy or trade!

Main Pokémon: Raichu, Haxorus, Eelektrik\nElectrify your game and shock your opponents when you play the Power Relay theme deck! Foes will find themselves ferociously short-circuited when Raichu unleashes its Slam attack and, if that doesn't blow their fuses, Haxorus will prove that lightning strikes twice with the stunning power of its Dual Chop and Giga Impact attacks. Eelektrik uses its Dynamotor Ability to find Energy and keep the current flowing, and a selection of Supporter cards ensures that your opposition won't be able to handle the static for long before the power goes out…permanently!

Beware the devious Mawile, a sweet-looking Pokémon with powerful steel jaws—and Mega Mawile-EX has even more chomping power! Get the Mega Mawile-EX Premium Collection, and add the Deceiver Pokémon to your next game! The Pokémon TCG: Mega Mawile-EX Premium Collection includes: • 1 never-before-seen foil promo card featuring Mega Mawile-EX • 1 never-before-seen foil promo card featuring Mawile-EX • 1 Mawile Spirit Link card to get this Mega Evolution Pokémon into play fast • 6 Pokémon TCG booster packs to mega-expand your collection • 1 cool new Mega Mawile coin

The powerful Paleozoic Pokémon Genesect explodes into action in the Mind Wipe theme deck! As its Jet Impact attack deals devastating destruction, Reuniclus reduces retaliation with Barrier Attack, and Kangaskhan pulls Pokémon into play with Call for Family. As this bewildering onslaught comes to a close, your rivals will be mired in the memories of their defeats!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a set of 9 Mossdeep themed promo cards and 8 basic Psychic Energy for you to enjoy or trade!

Who's afraid of the dark? Your opponent will be when you play the Nightfall theme deck. Powerful Pokémon with devastating attacks prowl the shadows: Metagross can do as much as 200 damage in one attack, Honchkrow takes advantage of your defeated Darkness Pokémon to do even more damage, and the Moonlight Pokémon Umbreon can do fearsome damage while protecting itself with its Moonlight Fang attack. When night falls, so will your opponent's Pokémon!

When you play the Pokémon TCG: Night Hunter theme deck, your opponents become the hunted! While Zoroark uses its Fury Swipes attack to stalk its next target, Excadrill zeroes in on the Defending Pokémon with its predatory Drill Run attack. Your opponents will learn to dread the night when you unleash the Night Hunter theme deck!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Braixen promo card and an XY—Fates Collide themed deck box for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Florges promo card and an XY—BREAKthrough themed deck box for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Delphox promo card and an XY—Fates Collide themed coin for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Xerneas promo card and an XY—Steam Siege themed deck box for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Flabébé promo card and a set of XY—BREAKthrough themed card sleeves for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Fennekin promo card and a set of XY—Fates Collide themed card sleeves for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Chikorita promo card and a set of XY—BREAKpoint themed card sleeves for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock four foil Volcanion promo cards and an XY—Steam Siege themed coin for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Bayleef promo card and an XY—BREAKpoint themed deck box for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Yveltal promo card and a set of XY—Steam Siege themed card sleeves for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Floette promo card and an XY—BREAKthrough themed coin for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Meganium promo card and an XY—BREAKpoint themed coin for you to enjoy or trade!

Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock 4 foil Pikachu promo cards, 4 foil Boulder Badge promo cards, 4 foil Cascade Badge promo cards, and a set of XY—Evolutions themed card sleeves for you to enjoy or trade!

Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock 4 foil Thunder Badge promo cards, 4 foil Rainbow Badge promo cards, 4 foil Soul Badge promo cards, and an XY—Evolutions themed deck box for you to enjoy or trade!

Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock 4 foil Marsh Badge promo cards, 4 foil Volcano Badge promo cards, 4 foil Earth Badge promo cards, and an XY—Evolutions themed coin for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a set of 9 Petalburg themed promo cards and 8 basic Grass Energy for you to enjoy or trade!

Lightning strikes and opponents feel the burn as the Cave Dragon Pokémon Druddigon explodes into action with the ferocious Dragon Claw attack! Infernape's Malevolent Fire attack fans the flames of your foes' defeat, and there's no skin thick enough to cope with Sharpedo's Rough Skin Ability. Once Jellicent drifts into range and its Spiteful Spirit Ability takes hold, even opponents with the cloudiest of minds will know the truth: they can't claw their way back into the game when you play the Plasma Claw theme deck!

Shadows loom and sparks fly as the Renegade Pokémon Giratina lays a Hex on any Pokémon that stands against it! A devastating chain reaction becomes a terrifying reality once Amoonguss gets in on the action with its damage-boosting Miracle Powder attack, and a shocking aftermath is inescapable once Weezing unleashes its Aftermath attack. Finally, as Watchog shows its teeth and snaps around the heels of fleeing Pokémon with its Second Bite attack, what once was murky will become blindingly clear: you'll cast a shadow over your foes with the Plasma Shadow theme deck!

Heavy hitters deliver pure power: it's up to you to control it! Gigalith rumbles into action with the Rock Bullet attack, and the Intimidation Pokémon Krookodile can make other Pokémon pull their punches every time it uses its sneaky Black Eyes Ability. Your opponents will be on the ropes as even little Minccino gets in on the action, packing a mighty punch for its mini size. With Pokémon chosen for their fighting fury, can your foes handle your power plays?

Mash your opponents' minds with mental might when you play the Psy Crusher theme deck! Use Leafeon's Energy Crush attack to turn the power of opposing Pokémon on themselves, and make sure no Pokémon can escape when you unleash Cofagrigus's Elongating Arms attack! Espeon keeps the reinforcements coming with Psy Alert, and Muk deals damage and heals itself. Then, when Beedrill Confuses and Poisons using Swift Sting, it won't take a mind-reader to know that the shattered remnants of the forces facing you have been crushed!

The Coffin Pokémon Cofagrigus rises to do your bidding when you play the Raiders theme deck! Send Sableye to raid your discard pile for Item cards that, when you discard them from your hand, let Cofagrigus bury your opponent's Pokémon with damage. Then send Krookodile in with its Dark Clamp and Bombast attacks to pin down the Defending Pokémon before enshrouding it in darkness in search of a Knock Out. Prove that you are skilled enough to ensure that your raiders become victors!

Rally your forces and charge into battle with the Rallying Cry promo deck! Wigglytuff, Exploud, and Palpitoad combine their voices in an extra-powerful Round attack. Cheren and Cilan support your troops with extra cards and Energy, and if you fall behind, Kangaskhan can sound a Call for Family to get more Pokémon into play. This is one cry your opponents won't be able to ignore!

At last, three great Pokémon-EX from the highest heights and strange new worlds! Choose the sky-high swiftness of Rayquaza-EX, the soaring speed of Latios-EX, or the mystical fury of Hoopa-EX in the Pokémon Trading Card Game: Powers Beyond Tin! Each of these rugged tins contains a Legendary or Mythical Pokémon-EX for your collection, so make friends with one of these powerful Pokémon today!

Two Mighty Pokémon Battle for Victory! Rayquaza and Keldeo go head to head in the new Pokémon TCG Battle Arena Decks! These two 60-card decks are ready to play right away, with powerful cards and winning strategies worthy of an ace Trainer! Each deck is led by an exceptional Pokémon-EX and includes 10 foil cards. Let the battle begin! In each 60-card deck, you'll find: • 2 foil cards featuring Rayquaza-EX or Keldeo-EX • 8 foil basic Energy cards • Tournament-level Trainer cards, including VS Seeker, N, and the never-before-seen Karen! In addition, each box contains: • 2 metallic coins • 2 deck boxes
Battle Arena Decks: Rayquaza vs. Keldeo

Unleash a firestorm in the Red Frenzy theme deck with the mighty Mega Fire Pig Pokémon Emboar! Feeling burned out after its tremendous Flare Blitz attack? Well, fan the flames with the Energy Retrieval Trainer card and reignite with Emboar's Heat Crash attack! Then, add fuel to the fire and insult to injury with Stoutland's Giga Impact attack! Let your opponents feel the heat when you play the Red Frenzy theme deck!

Let Nidoking lead from the front and unleash its devastating Venomous Horn attack to punish and Poison your foe's Pokémon! Then, bring the opposition to its knees as Machamp steps up to deliver your crowning achievement with its majestic Hundred Furious Punches attack…. And, if revolution is in the air, the Twins Supporter card will help crush any challenge to your sovereignty by rewarding you with extra cards! Will your rule be absolute with the Royal Guard theme deck?
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a set of 9 Rustboro themed promo cards and 8 basic Metal Energy for you to enjoy or trade!

When Zoroark emerges from the shadows, there won't be a shadow of a doubt about who will win! Even if Zoroark takes a hit or two, its Dark Rush attack does more damage for each damage counter on it. And while Empoleon uses its Diving Draw Ability to give you greater access to your deck, your other Pokémon can use their fast and effective attacks to do damage, cause Confusion, and then put out your opponent's lights. Make your opponents afraid of their own shadows when you play the Shadows theme deck!

The valiant Sun Pokémon Volcarona commands the battlefield in the Solar Strike theme deck! As it torments your opponents with the Leech Life attack and calls reinforcements with Solar Transporter, Glalie and Ursaring move into position for their own fiendish offensive, and Blastoise's Deluge Ability ensures your attacks have the Energy they need. It won't be long before your foes are blinded by your brilliance!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a set of 9 Sootopolis themed promo cards and 8 basic Water Energy for you to enjoy or trade!

The Claw Barrage theme deck lets you outplay and outwit your opponent with Darkness-type moves and Fairy-type tricks! Wigglytuff is super cute and easy to underestimate, but capable of dishing out some serious damage with its Balloon Barrage, while the edgy Bisharp brandishes its Metal Claw at your opponents. Leave them wondering what happened with the Claw Barrage theme deck!

Latios and Latias lead the way in the Eon Strike Deck, combining their strength and speed to soar past the opposition! This deck brings together Fighting types like Machoke and Solrock, Grass types like Tangrowth and Lombre, and handy Trainer cards like Acro Bike into a team fully trained for battle. When the Eon Pokémon join forces, they are ready to strike down your opponent!

Turn the tables on your opponents with the Toxic Tricks theme deck! Gothitelle's Mental Shock attack will confuse and confound your opponents, and Scolipede's poisonous double-dose Toxic Claws attack will leave your opponents feeling more than a little tricked! And, when Gothita gets in the mix with its sleep-inducing Hypnotic Gaze, your opponents will be Poisoned, Asleep, Confused, and beaten in no time!

Send shivers down your opponent's spine and spread the damage around with Mamoswine's chilling Snowstorm attack! Then, let your foes know they've been given the cold shoulder, and cause panic to take root as Kricketune sows Confusion before delivering its mighty Fury Cutter attack! And, if it looks like you've been cut down to size, support comes from the Black Belt Trainer card, which causes hefty bonus damage! Can the Verdant Frost theme deck make the grass greener on your side?

Get ready to watch your opponents spin out of control! The Voltage Vortex theme deck will shock them with every attack—from Zekrom's Bolt Strike to Luxray's Flash Impact…and beyond! Add the possibility of 160 damage when Raichu charges up its Slam attack, and your opponents will be waiting for the next jolt—your exciting victory!

Pokémon TCG Battle Arena Decks bring you two ready-to-play decks with cards worthy of a champion: new foil promo versions of Xerneas and Yveltal, plus powerful attack-boosting cards to fuel Yveltal's all-out assaults and sharp defensive cards that will keep Xerneas one leap ahead. The premium Battle Arena cards will get players and collectors hungry for these special decks!
Battle Arena Decks: Xerneas vs. Yveltal

Start your adventure in the Kalos region with the Water-type Pokémon Froakie and this 60-card ready-to-play deck! This new deck leaps over the competition with Froakie's unexpected powers, including all the shifting speed and thrilling moves that Water-type Pokémon are famous for! Move like a roaring river and carve your channel to victory—grab the Froakie deck and get ready to play!

Start your adventure in the Kalos region with the Grass-type Pokémon Chespin and this 60-card ready-to-play deck! With spikes, toughness, and resilient Grass-type moves, this new deck is perfect for the small but fierce competitor who never gives up! With quiet strength, it grows and grows to outperform and outlast the competition! Plant the seeds of your future victory—start with the Chespin deck!

Start your adventure in the Kalos region with the Fire-type Pokémon Fennekin and this 60-card ready-to-play deck! This new deck unlocks a world of exciting Pokémon battles and gives you the head-start you need to battle and win in the Pokémon Trading Card Game! As a Fire-type deck, the Fennekin deck is full of powerful moves—grab it and blaze your path to victory!

Reality Shifts—and Is Remade! Mega Alakazam-EX sees the future—and shapes it to unify two worlds! The Legendary Pokémon Zygarde arrives in many different Formes to bring order, together with Lugia BREAK, Mega Altaria-EX, and Umbreon-EX. Fates are sealed, and two Pokémon worlds join together in the Pokémon TCG: XY—Fates Collide expansion! Join the Elite Trainers with the TCG: XY—Fates Collide Elite Trainer Box! Inside, you'll find: • 8 Pokémon TCG: XY—Fates Collide booster packs • 65 card sleeves featuring Mega Alakazam • 45 Pokémon TCG Energy cards • A player's guide to the XY—Fates Collide expansion • 6 damage-counter dice • 1 competition-legal coin-flip die • 2 acrylic condition markers • A collector's box to hold everything, with 4 dividers to keep it organized • A code card for the Pokémon Trading Card Game Online
XY—Fates Collide Elite Trainer Box: Mega Alakazam

A Swift Strike of Darkness! \nLeave your opponents in the dust with the Destruction Rush theme deck! Yveltal retrieves lost Energy for a quick recovery with Oblivion Wing and wields the devastating Darkness Blade to great effect. Krookodile can Knock Back a battle-ready Pokémon to the Bench and keep powerful Supporter cards out of play. With Malamar's Mental Panic to keep your opponent's attacks at bay, retaliation won't be easy—and the rush to destruction will be complete!

A Strong Shield of Energy! \nResist, refuel, and retaliate with the Resilient Life theme deck! Xerneas can find Fairy Energy to recharge your Benched Pokémon, and Aromatisse moves that Energy around to wherever you need it most. Once your Pokémon have Fairy Energy attached, things get even better: Slurpuff's Sweet Veil Ability protects them from Special Conditions, and the Fairy Garden Stadium card lets them retreat for free! Flexible defenses are the key to your victory!

Lightning strikes and fires rage when you bring the Brilliant Thunder theme deck to battle! Harness the might of Pidgeot's Strong Gust to deliver booming blows to your foes. Bring your opponents to their knees as you buffet them with the thunderous strike force of Lopunny and Heliolisk! Fuel the ferocious flames with Fiery Torch and, as the sky begins to fall on your adversaries, deliver the final word with Snorlax's Sleepy Press! As the smoke clears, will you leave your opponents thunderstruck?

It never rains but it pours for your opponent when you bring the Mystic Typhoon theme deck to battle! Muddle your opponents' minds with Meowstic's Ear Influence attack, and turn a tide of damage upon them with Walrein's Big Tusk! Keep the Energy flowing with Milotic's sacrificial Energy Grace Ability, and dig up more cards to create the perfect storm with Furret's Buried Treasure Hunt before unleashing waves of fury boosted by the Muscle Band Trainer card. Can anyone weather your storms?

Bring the hammer down with the Dark Hammer theme deck! Get your hardest hitters into battle-ready mode quickly with handy Trainer cards like Evosoda and Korrina. Mienshao pulls a tricky hit-and-run as Pangoro hammers away at your opponent's deck. Landorus keeps your team powered up with Energy, and Professor Sycamore refills your hand. With Machamp's Fighting Fury Ability to boost your attacks, your opponent could be in for a dark fate!

Disrupt your opponent's strategy and protect your team with the Enchanted Echo theme deck! With Sylveon to keep Energy away from opposing Pokémon and Tornadus to shove them back to the Bench, your path will be clear to dish out the hits. Add in the damage prevention of Clefable and Accelgor, plus the healing powers of Victreebel and Potion, and your victory could echo through the ages!

Lightning and water make a dangerous combination—for your opponents! Galvantula can spin a bright Electroweb, while Heliolisk powers up its Parabolic Spark. At the same time, Kingler can drop the big Crabhammer, and Feraligatr's Hyper Whirlpool is ready to pull the foe under. To maximize your odds, Frillish and Jellicent confuse and befuddle opposing Pokémon—sometimes the path to victory takes a few twists and turns, and sometimes you can bolt to the top!

Carry a fiery storm under your wings with the Burning Winds theme deck! Let Talonflame light up the sky with Jet Shoot, while Venomoth stirs up a Dizzying Wind to keep a foe guessing-and with Yanmega's Windfall to refill your hand, you can fly the unfriendly skies with ease. Add in Pyroar's Flare Command and Loudred's Energy Press to turn your opponent's resources in your favor, and total air superiority could be yours!

Shake the pillars of the Pokémon world with the Earth's Pulse theme deck! The Continent Pokémon Groudon leads the charge, breaking ground on a massive scale, while little Linoone rushes your opponent's Bench with a Dash Attack! Medicham's Ω Barrage Ancient Trait brings an extra hit every turn, while unexpected allies like Eelektrik and Electrike turn up the voltage with Buzz Flip and Charge! Smash 'em with Fighting, zap 'em with Lightning, and leave your opponent shocked, socked, and pulverized!

Opposites working together create a furious maelstrom! The Ocean's Core theme deck brings together the raging Ocean Cyclone of Kyogre and the blazing inferno of Combusken. Thanks to its α Growth Ancient Trait, Whiscash can power up fast to unleash a fearsome Earthquake, while Milotic uses Aqua Swirl to put your opponent's big attackers on the Bench! So take a shot with this medley of Fire and Water—because when the ocean burns, nothing can stop you!

Overwhelm your opponent with the shimmering majesty of the Aurora Blast theme deck! Let the Freeze Pokémon Articuno lead the way with a Freezing Wind, while Victini paralyzes the foe with a Psy Bolt or two! Then let Salamence swoop in with Power Howl and Steam Blast to ramp up your offense. Combine these with Swellow's Δ Plus Ancient Trait for extra Prize cards, and you can knock out your opponent's northern lights!

The Storm Rider theme deck goes BOOM in more ways than one! Strike from above with bolts of lightning while keeping your opponent off balance with some twisty Grass-type tricks! Zapdos can bring the Raging Thunder while Dragonite makes a Heavy Impact—and picks up extra Prize cards with its Δ Plus Ancient Trait. To really crank up the noise, call on Shedinja for a Hopeless Scream that can make your opponent howl in despair as you sound your victory cry!

Fury of Waves, Song of Steel! \nCrush your opponents with iron or sink them in the depths—either way you wield the chilling might of the Iron Tide theme deck! With Metagross leading the way, this deck shines like steel from the start. Add in some big attacks like Forbidden Iron Hammer from Registeel and Hydro Splash from Vaporeon, and your opponent is awash in trouble, bubbles, and a steely doom! Then evolve Magikarp to Gyarados to truly thrash opposing Pokémon, and watch the tide of the battle turn in your favor!

Strength of Spirit, Strength of Stone! \nThis deck's got heart—the kind of prizefighter's heart that never quits! With the Stone Heart theme deck, your Pokémon can poison, paralyze, and trick opposing Pokémon in many ways—and the mighty Regirock leads the way, with its Unyielding Rock attack perfect for taking down Pokémon-EX! Add in the Legendary Pokémon Virizion with the power to hit harder if you're behind, and the Stone Heart deck is full of fighting spirit. This is one contender that's never down for the count!

The two Pokémon TCG: Legendary Collections bring you the beloved Pikachu or the mischievous Hoopa as a powerful new Pokémon-EX, plus five different full-art Legendary Pokémon. These collections deliver some of the most famous characters from throughout the Pokémon world!

The two Pokémon TCG: Legendary Collections bring you the beloved Pikachu or the mischievous Hoopa as a powerful new Pokémon-EX, plus five different full-art Legendary Pokémon. These collections deliver some of the most famous characters from throughout the Pokémon world!

A Pokémon treasure chest! Carry your collection anywhere, or share a trove of Pokémon treasures with a fan! This sturdy metal case contains more than a dozen special Pokémon goodies, including many not found anywhere else.
Let Sparks Fly!\nRun circles around your opponent's Pokémon with lightning speed, or burn them with a well-placed jet of flame—let loose with the full heat of the Burning Spark theme deck!
XY—BREAKthrough Elite Trainer Box: Mega Mewtwo X
XY—BREAKthrough Elite Trainer Box: Mega Mewtwo Y
Sound a Victory Cry!\nLet rip with a scream from the night, and weave your path to victory in the darkness. Seize the power of Noivern and Gengar in the Night Striker theme deck!

Eyes on the Prize!\nCommand the gleaming eyes of Luxray and strike fast with the crackling fists of Electivire! Stare down your opponent with the hypnotic mastery and total focus of the Electric Eye theme deck!
Call the Ocean's Fury!\nCut through waves and slash foes in the battle arena—flow like water and bend like grass! Greninja and Slowking come to your call in the Wave Slasher theme deck!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.products.p: Main Pokémon: Articuno, Gyarados, Lapras\nChill your opponent to the bone with this Water-type deck! Articuno can find Energy and then let loose a Freezing Wind attack. Gyarados can hit the opposing Pokémon hard and weaken every other Pokémon in play with a Berserker Splash. Lapras helps out by fetching from your deck the exact Trainer card you need! Add some awesome Trainer and Energy cards like Max Revive and Splash Energy to keep your deck strong for the long battle, and this deck displays the hidden power of the deeps!

Main Pokémon: Articuno, Gyarados, Lapras\nChill your opponent to the bone with this Water-type deck! Articuno can find Energy and then let loose a Freezing Wind attack. Gyarados can hit the opposing Pokémon hard and weaken every other Pokémon in play with a Berserker Splash. Lapras helps out by fetching from your deck the exact Trainer card you need! Add some awesome Trainer and Energy cards like Max Revive and Splash Energy to keep your deck strong for the long battle, and this deck displays the hidden power of the deeps!

Main Pokémon: Butterfree, Meganium, Torterra \nThis deck has plenty of punch mixed with healing! Meganium's Giant Bloom does 60 damage for {G}{C}{C} and heals 20 damage, and Torterra's Giga Drain attack does 40 damage for {G}{C}{C} and heals the damage done. Wigglytuff has 90 HP, and when it uses Expand, it reduces damage to itself on the next turn. It may look a little softer than the HS: Basic Blue or HS: Basic Red decks, but the staying power of Grass will outlast your opponent!

Main Pokémon: Butterfree, Meganium, Torterra \nThis deck has plenty of punch mixed with healing! Meganium's Giant Bloom does 60 damage for {G}{C}{C} and heals 20 damage, and Torterra's Giga Drain attack does 40 damage for {G}{C}{C} and heals the damage done. Wigglytuff has 90 HP, and when it uses Expand, it reduces damage to itself on the next turn. It may look a little softer than the HS: Basic Blue or HS: Basic Red decks, but the staying power of Grass will outlast your opponent!

Main Pokémon: Conkeldurr, Gigalith, Throh \nThe new BW: Basic Orange deck is ready to deliver a Knock Out blow! This furious Fighting-type deck features Throh, Conkeldurr, and the mighty mighty Gigalith for hard-hitting power! Throh has a Circle Throw to force your opponent to switch Active Pokémon, or a Storm Throw for 80 damage not affected by Resistance! And Gigalith's Shear attack attaches Energy to it, and Rock Bullet does 20 more damage for every {F} Energy attached: building power! Conkeldurr brings the amazing Craftsmanship Ability to give Fighting-type Pokémon +20 HP for every {F} Energy attached—this is a deck that can take a hit and just…. Keeps…. GOING!

Main Pokémon: Moltres, Ninetales, Arcanine\nBurn it up with this Fire-type deck! Arcanine and Rapidash have big attacks that discard Energy—attach a Burning Energy so it comes right back, or use an Energy Retrieval Trainer card. Moltres is a giant Basic Pokémon that can deliver huge damage at the cost of hitting itself. And when Ninetales attacks with Flickering Flames, the hypnotic effect leaves your opponent's Pokémon Asleep. With Trainer cards like Scorched Earth and Professor Sycamore to keep your hand fired up, you can really bring on the heat!

Main Pokémon: Moltres, Ninetales, Arcanine\nBurn it up with this Fire-type deck! Arcanine and Rapidash have big attacks that discard Energy—attach a Burning Energy so it comes right back, or use an Energy Retrieval Trainer card. Moltres is a giant Basic Pokémon that can deliver huge damage at the cost of hitting itself. And when Ninetales attacks with Flickering Flames, the hypnotic effect leaves your opponent's Pokémon Asleep. With Trainer cards like Scorched Earth and Professor Sycamore to keep your hand fired up, you can really bring on the heat!

Main Pokémon: Zapdos, Raichu, Kangaskhan\nThis Lightning-type deck is a rolling slugfest! Kangaskhan brings the big hits while Zapdos unleashes its Raging Thunder. Raticate can leave your opponent's Pokémon Poisoned, but they can't return the favor because it's immune to Special Conditions. With an extra-full Bench thanks to the Sky Field Stadium card, Raichu's Circle Circuit attack can hit for tons of damage! Finally, Trainer cards like Potion and Pokémon Fan Club can keep you in the game, and Double Colorless Energy can power up your Pokémon fast!

Your opponents will soon find themselves in troubled waters with the Blue Assault theme deck, especially when you unleash Galvantula! Its Electroweb attack is sure to leave them in sticky situations, and its Leech Life attack will keep your own Pokémon going strong! Use Basculin's Crunch attack to leave your opponent's Pokémon high and dry while Professor Juniper brings you calm waters. Will you be able to batter the opposition with the Blue Assault theme deck?

Play the Green Tornado theme deck to blow away the opposition while sheltering your own Pokémon with Serperior's Leaf Storm attack! Then, bring Sawsbuck into the action and overwhelm your opponent's Pokémon with its "the greener, the meaner" Nature Power attack! And if your opponents can weather the storm with tough Pokémon, let them ride it out in peaceful slumbers with Musharna's Hypnotic Ray attack! With the Green Tornado theme deck, will you whirl your way to victory?

Unleash a firestorm in the Red Frenzy theme deck with the mighty Mega Fire Pig Pokémon Emboar! Feeling burned out after its tremendous Flare Blitz attack? Well, fan the flames with the Energy Retrieval Trainer card and reignite with Emboar's Heat Crash attack! Then, add fuel to the fire and insult to injury with Stoutland's Giga Impact attack! Let your opponents feel the heat when you play the Red Frenzy theme deck!

Heavy hitters deliver pure power: it's up to you to control it! Gigalith rumbles into action with the Rock Bullet attack, and the Intimidation Pokémon Krookodile can make other Pokémon pull their punches every time it uses its sneaky Black Eyes Ability. Your opponents will be on the ropes as even little Minccino gets in on the action, packing a mighty punch for its mini size. With Pokémon chosen for their fighting fury, can your foes handle your power plays?

Turn the tables on your opponents with the Toxic Tricks theme deck! Gothitelle's Mental Shock attack will confuse and confound your opponents, and Scolipede's poisonous double-dose Toxic Claws attack will leave your opponents feeling more than a little tricked! And, when Gothita gets in the mix with its sleep-inducing Hypnotic Gaze, your opponents will be Poisoned, Asleep, Confused, and beaten in no time!

Dazzle your opponents with the Fast Daze theme deck! With its low-cost attacks and no Retreat Cost, Accelgor can get in and out of battle in the blink of an eye! Volcarona's Fiery Dance powers up your best attacks with blazing speed, and Lilligant's healing touch can get your quickest fighters back into the fray! You could be on the fast track to success!

Dazzle your opponents with the Fast Daze theme deck! With its low-cost attacks and no Retreat Cost, Accelgor can get in and out of battle in the blink of an eye! Volcarona's Fiery Dance powers up your best attacks with blazing speed, and Lilligant's healing touch can get your quickest fighters back into the fray! You could be on the fast track to success!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

Send in the cavalry with the Furious Knights theme deck! Quick hitters like Emolga give you time to marshal your forces, and the slow and sturdy Escavalier can dish out the damage while protecting itself. Plus, Druddigon's Rough Skin Ability will make your opponent think twice about attacking! In a furious battle, victory could be yours!

Send in the cavalry with the Furious Knights theme deck! Quick hitters like Emolga give you time to marshal your forces, and the slow and sturdy Escavalier can dish out the damage while protecting itself. Plus, Druddigon's Rough Skin Ability will make your opponent think twice about attacking! In a furious battle, victory could be yours!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

Attack after devastating attack, you'll drive your opponents to the edge of defeat when you play the Explosive Edge theme deck! With Reshiram's fiery Blue Flare attack and Beartic's powerful Ambush attack, you'll blast your opponent's Pokémon turn after turn. And when Chandelure and Arcanine add even more cutting-edge attacks to your battles, you can expect every victory to be exceptional!

Get ready to watch your opponents spin out of control! The Voltage Vortex theme deck will shock them with every attack—from Zekrom's Bolt Strike to Luxray's Flash Impact…and beyond! Add the possibility of 160 damage when Raichu charges up its Slam attack, and your opponents will be waiting for the next jolt—your exciting victory!

The Coffin Pokémon Cofagrigus rises to do your bidding when you play the Raiders theme deck! Send Sableye to raid your discard pile for Item cards that, when you discard them from your hand, let Cofagrigus bury your opponent's Pokémon with damage. Then send Krookodile in with its Dark Clamp and Bombast attacks to pin down the Defending Pokémon before enshrouding it in darkness in search of a Knock Out. Prove that you are skilled enough to ensure that your raiders become victors!

Shadows loom and sparks fly as the Renegade Pokémon Giratina lays a Hex on any Pokémon that stands against it! A devastating chain reaction becomes a terrifying reality once Amoonguss gets in on the action with its damage-boosting Miracle Powder attack, and a shocking aftermath is inescapable once Weezing unleashes its Aftermath attack. Finally, as Watchog shows its teeth and snaps around the heels of fleeing Pokémon with its Second Bite attack, what once was murky will become blindingly clear: you'll cast a shadow over your foes with the Plasma Shadow theme deck!

When dragons snarl, opponents fall! With the DragonSnarl theme deck, Pokémon like Skuntank, Golurk, and Gothitelle lead the charge and pave the way for your powerhouse Dragon-type Pokémon, Hydreigon, to roar into battle! As the Brutal Pokémon brings its aggressive combination of healing and devastating attacks to combat, your opponents will hear their defeat because they hear your dragons snarl!

Foes must make way for the mighty Mach Pokémon Garchomp or quickly learn a furious lesson! But time and tide wait for no Pokémon, and your opponents will have much to fear before that terrible arrival: Walrein will bring watery doom, speedily delivering wave after wave of Aurora Beam and Ice Entomb attacks…and there will be no respite when Marowak gets in on the action with its heavy-hitting Vortex Chop! With nowhere to run and no time to catch breath, can anyone match the dragons' speed?

Watch foes feel the heat as White Kyurem sets your game ablaze in the Cold Fire theme deck! Send opponents on a slippery downward spiral with Samurott's Destructive Whirlpool attack, and run rings around them as they try to fend off Darmanitan's ferocious Damage Counterpunch attack. And, with Delibird, Delcatty, and Dunsparce delivering you deck-searching delights to drive the flames ever higher, your opponents will be going out…but not in a blaze of glory!

Feel the chill as Black Kyurem takes center stage in the electrifying Ice Shock theme deck! Foes have no time to stop and stare as Black Kyurem unleashes its electrifying Flash Freeze attack, and with Jellicent's Stickiness Ability, they won't even be able to run and hide! The jolts continue as Lopunny takes time out from healing to drive the Defending Pokémon back to the Bench, helping Electivire blow your opponents' fuses as it delivers punishing attacks to Benched Pokémon. Can those who stand in your way avoid the blackout?

Lightning strikes and opponents feel the burn as the Cave Dragon Pokémon Druddigon explodes into action with the ferocious Dragon Claw attack! Infernape's Malevolent Fire attack fans the flames of your foes' defeat, and there's no skin thick enough to cope with Sharpedo's Rough Skin Ability. Once Jellicent drifts into range and its Spiteful Spirit Ability takes hold, even opponents with the cloudiest of minds will know the truth: they can't claw their way back into the game when you play the Plasma Claw theme deck!

Shadows loom and sparks fly as the Renegade Pokémon Giratina lays a Hex on any Pokémon that stands against it! A devastating chain reaction becomes a terrifying reality once Amoonguss gets in on the action with its damage-boosting Miracle Powder attack, and a shocking aftermath is inescapable once Weezing unleashes its Aftermath attack. Finally, as Watchog shows its teeth and snaps around the heels of fleeing Pokémon with its Second Bite attack, what once was murky will become blindingly clear: you'll cast a shadow over your foes with the Plasma Shadow theme deck!

Freeze your foes with fear when you play the Frost Ray theme deck! Use Glaceon's Icy Wind attack to send opposing Pokémon into a cold, deep sleep, and Vanilluxe's powerful ChillMAX attack to let them know they're in for a rude awakening! You'll command the battlefield with superior speed using Glaceon's Freeze Zone Ability, and help keep the Energy flowing with Electrode's Magnetic Draw. Then, as you call Team Plasma Pokémon and Trainer cards from the discard pile with Raticate's Transfer Junk attack, your opponents will know anyone unwary enough to challenge you will be put on ice!

Mash your opponents' minds with mental might when you play the Psy Crusher theme deck! Use Leafeon's Energy Crush attack to turn the power of opposing Pokémon on themselves, and make sure no Pokémon can escape when you unleash Cofagrigus's Elongating Arms attack! Espeon keeps the reinforcements coming with Psy Alert, and Muk deals damage and heals itself. Then, when Beedrill Confuses and Poisons using Swift Sting, it won't take a mind-reader to know that the shattered remnants of the forces facing you have been crushed!

With the Recon theme deck, you'll help your opponent discover what every good lookout knows—there's no smoke without fire. And where there's fire, there's Magmortar! Survey the destruction as its Mantle Bazooka attack does 100 damage to anything in its path. Meganium ensures opposing Pokémon are caught sleeping on their watch, and relentlessly test your foe's defenses with Tangrowth's slow-burning Grind attack…. Then, watch as its crushing crescendo reminds your opposition just what the lay of the land really is!

Set your opponents reeling with ferocious counterattacks when you play the Retort theme deck! While Groudon builds its powerful Volcano Stomp attack from your Bench, Hitmontop's rapid response is its Triple Kick attack that can do 60 damage for only 1 Energy! And if your opponent thinks that sending your Pokémon to the Lost Zone is a good strategy, Lucario has a stunning answer to that with its Dimension Sphere attack. The Retort theme deck could be the answer to your victory!
Forest Force
Polar Frost
Bombardment
Metal Surge
Dark Rampage
Raging Sea

The greatest fires begin with a single spark...and the Ember Spark theme deck will fan your flames of victory! Use Noctowl to add extra cards to your hand so you can build up the Energy to let Arcanine and Typhlosion use their impressive Fire Mane and Fire Spin attacks for 90 and 120 damage! By drawing and discarding at lightning speed, you'll burn through your opponent's defenses in no time!

Your victories will be in full bloom when you battle using the Growth Clash theme deck! Furret helps you find the Pokémon you need, Sandslash batters the Defending Pokémon with Poison Sting, and Meganium uses Giant Bloom to both attack your opponent's Pokémon and heal itself at the same time. Can you wield the furious powers of these Pokémon to grow stronger and defeat your opponents?

Let the waves wash over your opponents when you play the Mind Flood theme deck! While Hypno spends turn after turn putting your opponent's Pokémon to sleep, Exeggutor's Big Eggsplosion attack washes away your opponent's hopes of victory with the potential for tons of damage. To top it off, Feraligatr roars in with its Spinning Tail attack to flood your opponent's side of the battle with damage!

The chaotic powers that have been unleashed can only be controlled by an amazing Pokémon Trainer. Is it you? In the Chaos Control theme deck, you'll need to balance devastating attacks like Tyranitar's Tail Crush and Lucario's Bulk Up against more strategic approaches like Mismagius's Psychic Pulse. With all of your opponent's Pokémon vulnerable to your battle plans, can you control your forces until victory is yours?

The best offense is a strong defense when you play the Steel Sentinel theme deck! Steelix's Guard Press attack reduces the damage your opponent can do...Cherrim's Sunny Heal Poké-Power heals your Active Pokémon turn after turn...Life Herb can do wonders to help your Pokémon last longer...and even Turtwig's Leech Seed attack heals Turtwig whenever it does damage to your opponent's Pokémon! Can you stand strong against all attackers?

You'll use every trick under the sun to defeat your opponent when you play the Daybreak theme deck! The versatile Sludge Pokémon Muk both inflicts Special Conditions on your opponent's Pokémon and then adds on damage to those already affected. And when the Sun Pokémon Espeon begins to move damage counters from your Pokémon across the battlefield to your opponent's Pokémon, it will dawn on your opponent just how versatile your Daybreak deck really is!

Who's afraid of the dark? Your opponent will be when you play the Nightfall theme deck. Powerful Pokémon with devastating attacks prowl the shadows: Metagross can do as much as 200 damage in one attack, Honchkrow takes advantage of your defeated Darkness Pokémon to do even more damage, and the Moonlight Pokémon Umbreon can do fearsome damage while protecting itself with its Moonlight Fang attack. When night falls, so will your opponent's Pokémon!

Let Nidoking lead from the front and unleash its devastating Venomous Horn attack to punish and Poison your foe's Pokémon! Then, bring the opposition to its knees as Machamp steps up to deliver your crowning achievement with its majestic Hundred Furious Punches attack… And, if revolution is in the air, the Twins Supporter card will help crush any challenge to your sovereignty by rewarding you with extra cards! Will your rule be absolute with the Royal Guard theme deck?

Send shivers down your opponent's spine and spread the damage around with Mamoswine's chilling Snowstorm attack! Then, let your foes know they've been given the cold shoulder, and cause panic to take root as Kricketune sows Confusion before delivering its mighty Fury Cutter attack! And, if it looks like you've been cut down to size, support comes from the Black Belt Trainer card, which causes hefty bonus damage! Can the Verdant Frost theme deck make the grass greener on your side?

Main Pokémon: Raichu, Haxorus, Eelektrik \nElectrify your game and shock your opponents when you play the Power Relay theme deck! Foes will find themselves ferociously short-circuited when Raichu unleashes its Slam attack and, if that doesn't blow their fuses, Haxorus will prove that lightning strikes twice with the stunning power of its Dual Chop and Giga Impact attacks. Eelektrik uses its Dynamotor Ability to find Energy and keep the current flowing, and a selection of Supporter cards ensures that your opposition won't be able to handle the static for long before the power goes out…permanently!

Main Pokémon: Gallade, Miltank, Swoobat\nDemonstrate your crushing brainpower with the Mental Might deck! Its three star players work together in a terrific trio. Swoobat's Energy Gift lends extra power to Gallade's Powerful Storm attack, and when Gallade is on your Bench, Miltank's Powerful Friends attack wallops your foe with 80 damage for just 1 {C} Energy! With this kind of teamwork, plus plenty of useful Trainer cards, your psychic powers could prevail!

Rally your forces and charge into battle with the Rallying Cry promo deck! Wigglytuff, Exploud, and Palpitoad combine their voices in an extra-powerful Round attack. Cheren and Cilan support your troops with extra cards and Energy, and if you fall behind, Kangaskhan can sound a Call for Family to get more Pokémon into play. This is one cry your opponents won't be able to ignore!

When you play the Pokémon TCG: Night Hunter theme deck, your opponents become the hunted! While Zoroark uses its Fury Swipes attack to stalk its next target, Excadrill zeroes in on the Defending Pokémon with its predatory Drill Run attack. Your opponents will learn to dread the night when you unleash the Night Hunter theme deck!

The Claw Barrage theme deck lets you outplay and outwit your opponent with Darkness-type moves and Fairy-type tricks! Wigglytuff is super cute and easy to underestimate, but capable of dishing out some serious damage with its Balloon Barrage, while the edgy Bisharp brandishes its Metal Claw at your opponents. Leave them wondering what happened with the Claw Barrage theme deck!

Start your adventure in the Kalos region with the Water-type Pokémon Froakie and this 60-card ready-to-play deck! This new deck leaps over the competition with Froakie's unexpected powers, including all the shifting speed and thrilling moves that Water-type Pokémon are famous for! Move like a roaring river and carve your channel to victory—grab the Froakie deck and get ready to play!

Start your adventure in the Kalos region with the Grass-type Pokémon Chespin and this 60-card ready-to-play deck! With spikes, toughness, and resilient Grass-type moves, this new deck is perfect for the small but fierce competitor who never gives up! With quiet strength, it grows and grows to outperform and outlast the competition! Plant the seeds of your future victory—start with the Chespin deck!

Start your adventure in the Kalos region with the Fire-type Pokémon Fennekin and this 60-card ready-to-play deck! This new deck unlocks a world of exciting Pokémon battles and gives you the head-start you need to battle and win in the Pokémon Trading Card Game! As a Fire-type deck, the Fennekin deck is full of powerful moves—grab it and blaze your path to victory!

Play the Mindbind theme deck and watch your opponents as their dreams are crushed and their minds are broken! As the Intertwining Pokémon Sylveon leaves foes in a tangle with its Fairy Wind attack, Noivern will wait in the wings with the second wave before unleashing its Second Bite attack. Ensnare your opposition with the Mindbind theme deck!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.products.t: The Legendary Pokémon Groudon-EX leads the way in the Earthshaker theme deck, a Fighting-type deck with some serious punch! When the ground splits open in a Massive Rend, will your opponents be able to recover?
Unlock the potential of little Magikarp and the power of the raging seas! This deck features Shiny Gyarados-EX and Regice, plus Splash Energy and some great Trainer cards!
The Legendary Pokémon Kyogre-EX is the star of the show in the Great Wave theme deck, a Water-type deck with a high-powered splash! Unleash a Giant Whirlpool on your opponents!
The Legendary Pokémon Kyogre-EX is the star of the show in the Great Wave theme deck, a Water-type deck with a high-powered splash! Unleash a Giant Whirlpool on your opponents!
This deck is ready for battle anytime! Enter the ring with big brawlers like Machamp-EX and Marowak, plus Strong Energy and some great Trainer cards!
Get ready for a Shatter Shot showdown with Mewtwo-EX and Meowstic in this energetic deck, with the help of Mystery Energy and some great Trainer cards!

Three great Legendary Pokémon-EX are revealed! Choose the forest majesty of Shiny Xerneas-EX, the destructive force of Shiny Yveltal-EX, or the battle-ready power of Zygarde-EX in the Pokémon Trading Card Game: Shiny Kalos Tin! Each of these rugged tins contains a mighty Pokémon-EX from the Kalos region—ready to battle and ready to win! In this tin, you'll find: • 1 of 3 special foil Pokémon-EX cards: Shiny Xerneas-EX, Shiny Yveltal-EX, or Zygarde-EX! • 4 Pokémon TCG booster packs! • A code card to unlock a playable deck in the Pokémon Trading Card Game Online!

Three great Legendary Pokémon-EX are revealed! Choose the forest majesty of Shiny Xerneas-EX, the destructive force of Shiny Yveltal-EX, or the battle-ready power of Zygarde-EX in the Pokémon Trading Card Game: Shiny Kalos Tin! Each of these rugged tins contains a mighty Pokémon-EX from the Kalos region—ready to battle and ready to win! In this tin, you'll find: • 1 of 3 special foil Pokémon-EX cards: Shiny Xerneas-EX, Shiny Yveltal-EX, or Zygarde-EX! • 4 Pokémon TCG booster packs! • A code card to unlock a playable deck in the Pokémon Trading Card Game Online!

Three great Legendary Pokémon-EX are revealed! Choose the forest majesty of Shiny Xerneas-EX, the destructive force of Shiny Yveltal-EX, or the battle-ready power of Zygarde-EX in the Pokémon Trading Card Game: Shiny Kalos Tin! Each of these rugged tins contains a mighty Pokémon-EX from the Kalos region—ready to battle and ready to win! In this tin, you'll find: • 1 of 3 special foil Pokémon-EX cards: Shiny Xerneas-EX, Shiny Yveltal-EX, or Zygarde-EX! • 4 Pokémon TCG booster packs! • A code card to unlock a playable deck in the Pokémon Trading Card Game Online!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.retro.deck: Lightning and water make a dangerous combination—for your opponents! Galvantula can spin a bright Electroweb, while Heliolisk powers up its Parabolic Spark. At the same time, Kingler can drop the big Crabhammer, and Feraligatr's Hyper Whirlpool is ready to pull the foe under. To maximize your odds, Frillish and Jellicent confuse and befuddle opposing Pokémon—sometimes the path to victory takes a few twists and turns, and sometimes you can bolt to the top!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

Lightning strikes and fires rage when you bring the Brilliant Thunder theme deck to battle! Harness the might of Pidgeot's Strong Gust to deliver booming blows to your foes. Bring your opponents to their knees as you buffet them with the thunderous strike force of Lopunny and Heliolisk! Fuel the ferocious flames with Fiery Torch and, as the sky begins to fall on your adversaries, deliver the final word with Snorlax's Sleepy Press! As the smoke clears, will you leave your opponents thunderstruck?\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

Carry a fiery storm under your wings with the Burning Winds theme deck! Let Talonflame light up the sky with Jet Shoot, while Venomoth stirs up a Dizzying Wind to keep a foe guessing—and with Yanmega's Windfall to refill your hand, you can fly the unfriendly skies with ease. Add in Pyroar's Flare Command and Loudred's Energy Press to turn your opponent's resources in your favor, and total air superiority could be yours!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

Bring the hammer down with the Dark Hammer theme deck! Get your hardest hitters into battle-ready mode quickly with handy Trainer cards like Evosoda and Korrina. Mienshao pulls a tricky hit-and-run as Pangoro hammers away at your opponent's deck. Landorus keeps your team powered up with Energy, and Professor Sycamore refills your hand. With Machamp's Fighting Fury Ability to boost your attacks, your opponent could be in for a dark fate!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

A Swift Strike of Darkness! 

Leave your opponents in the dust with the Destruction Rush theme deck! Yveltal retrieves lost Energy for a quick recovery with Oblivion Wing and wields the devastating Darkness Blade to great effect. Krookodile can Knock Back a battle-ready Pokémon to the Bench and keep powerful Supporter cards out of play. With Malamar's Mental Panic to keep your opponent's attacks at bay, retaliation won't be easy—and the rush to destruction will be complete!

Available for a limited time!

Shake the pillars of the Pokémon world with the Earth's Pulse theme deck! The Continent Pokémon Groudon leads the charge, breaking ground on a massive scale, while little Linoone rushes your opponent's Bench with a Dash Attack! Medicham's Ω Barrage Ancient Trait brings an extra hit every turn, while unexpected allies like Eelektrik and Electrike turn up the voltage with Buzz Flip and Charge! Smash 'em with Fighting, zap 'em with Lightning, and leave your opponent shocked, socked, and pulverized!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

Disrupt your opponent's strategy and protect your team with the Enchanted Echo theme deck! With Sylveon to keep Energy away from opposing Pokémon and Tornadus to shove them back to the Bench, your path will be clear to dish out the hits. Add in the damage prevention of Clefable and Accelgor, plus the healing powers of Victreebel and Potion, and your victory could echo through the ages!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

It never rains but it pours for your opponent when you bring the Mystic Typhoon theme deck to battle! Muddle your opponents' minds with Meowstic's Ear Influence attack, and turn a tide of damage upon them with Walrein's Big Tusk! Keep the Energy flowing with Milotic's sacrificial Energy Grace Ability, and dig up more cards to create the perfect storm with Furret's Buried Treasure Hunt before unleashing waves of fury boosted by the Muscle Band Trainer card. Can anyone weather your storms?\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

Opposites working together create a furious maelstrom! The Ocean's Core theme deck brings together the raging Ocean Cyclone of Kyogre and the blazing inferno of Combusken. Thanks to its α Growth Ancient Trait, Whiscash can power up fast to unleash a fearsome Earthquake, while Milotic uses Aqua Swirl to put your opponent's big attackers on the Bench! So take a shot with this medley of Fire and Water—because when the ocean burns, nothing can stop you!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

A Strong Shield of Energy! 

Resist, refuel, and retaliate with the Resilient Life theme deck! Xerneas can find Fairy Energy to recharge your Benched Pokémon, and Aromatisse moves that Energy around to wherever you need it most. Once your Pokémon have Fairy Energy attached, things get even better: Slurpuff's Sweet Veil Ability protects them from Special Conditions, and the Fairy Garden Stadium card lets them retreat for free! Flexible defenses are the key to your victory!

Available for a limited time!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.retro.prod: Overwhelm your opponent with the shimmering majesty of the Aurora Blast theme deck! Let the Freeze Pokémon Articuno lead the way with a Freezing Wind, while Victini paralyzes the foe with a Psy Bolt or two! Then let Salamence swoop in with Power Howl and Steam Blast to ramp up your offense. Combine these with Swellow's Δ Plus Ancient Trait for extra Prize cards, and you can knock out your opponent's northern lights!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

The Storm Rider theme deck goes BOOM in more ways than one! Strike from above with bolts of lightning while keeping your opponent off balance with some twisty Grass-type tricks! Zapdos can bring the Raging Thunder while Dragonite makes a Heavy Impact—and picks up extra Prize cards with its Δ Plus Ancient Trait. To really crank up the noise, call on Shedinja for a Hopeless Scream that can make your opponent howl in despair as you sound your victory cry!\n\nAvailable for a limited time!

Fury of Waves, Song of Steel! 

Crush your opponents with iron or sink them in the depths—either way you wield the chilling might of the Iron Tide theme deck! With Metagross leading the way, this deck shines like steel from the start. Add in some big attacks like Forbidden Iron Hammer from Registeel and Hydro Splash from Vaporeon, and your opponent is awash in trouble, bubbles, and a steely doom! Then evolve Magikarp to Gyarados to truly thrash opposing Pokémon, and watch the tide of the battle turn in your favor!

Available for a limited time!

Strength of Spirit, Strength of Stone! This deck's got heart—the kind of prizefighter's heart that never quits! With the Stone Heart theme deck, your Pokémon can poison, paralyze, and trick opposing Pokémon in many ways—and the mighty Regirock leads the way, with its Unyielding Rock attack perfect for taking down Pokémon-EX! Add in the Legendary Pokémon Virizion with the power to hit harder if you're behind, and the Stone Heart deck is full of fighting spirit. This is one contender that's never down for the count! Available for a limited time!
Platinum League champions earn the right to participate in the City Championship! Play against the best of the best as you try to outthink and outplay your way to the top!
Every player starts out in the prestigious Gold League. Defeat all 12 opponents to become the champion of the Gold League!
Only Gold League champions may participate in the Platinum League. The competition is fierce and the opponents are crafty as you battle your way through 12 opponents.

Ali is best friends with Brittney and usually enjoys having Juji around...unless she's being annoying! Brittney taught her to play the Pokémon TCG some time ago, but she's only really gotten into it recently. She's also into fortune-telling, so she's handy with cards. Her shuffle is a sight to see!
Brittney likes to act and sing in school plays, and she dabbles in photography. She likes to take pictures of flowers and animals. She is best friends with Ali...unless they are playing Pokémon!

Don't let Calvin's nervous demeanor fool you. His sister Penelope placed third last year, and she's taught him all her tricks. Besides playing the Pokémon TCG, his favorite things are reading poetry and playing cribbage. Don't count him out just because he's new to the game!

Cammie likes reading and hanging out with her science club pals. What she really loves, though, is destroying her brother Grayson (or anyone else who's handy) at Pokémon. She's come in first in several Leagues, and she is playing odd decks just to feel challenged again.

Daniel has been playing the Pokémon TCG competitively since he was 12. He's attended the World Championships several times, and he placed 61st one year. Though he's pursuing a Ph.D. in political science, he still takes time out to practice the violin…and play Pokémon.

Ella's parents own a game store and encouraged her love of TCGs. She now works with Zach at her parents' store, running Leagues and teaching kids to do magic tricks. She's proud of how many of her store's regulars have gone on to win big tournaments, but is also a little envious.

Grayson shares a love of cars (especially hot rods) with his League friends Mick and Tyson. He's a student at a local college. He's been playing Pokémon since it first came out and is a formidable opponent...though not as formidable as his sister, Cammie.

Baking and drawing are Juji's favorite hobbies. She worships Brittney and Ali, and wants to become a competitive Pokémon player. Beneath a veneer of timidity, she burns with a need to prove that she's not just a wilting flower.

Kendall isn't just a skilled TCG player—she's also a successful Mathlete who loves statistics, manga, and electronic music. When she goes to tournaments, she can often be found playing Pokémon games on her Nintendo DS system between rounds.

Logan used to collect Pokémon cards when he was younger, and recently he got into playing the game. He's always confident of victory, even when things aren't going his way. When he's not playing cards, he's training to become a park ranger.

Mick has been League Champion several times, and he just can't imagine his friends Tyson and Grayson will ever beat him! He's into mixed martial arts and is taking boxing classes at a local gym. When he's not working out, he likes talking about cars with Tyson and Grayson.

Nathan is originally from Winnipeg, Canada. When he's not playing Pokémon, you can find him on the ice playing hockey. He also came in second in his school's spelling bee. He loves to trade cards, and he aims to collect one of every card available!

Otis is a latecomer to the Pokémon TCG, but after joining up with Daniel and Rika, he's become a force to be reckoned with.  He's a man of few words, but he regularly attends football games, and his backpack is usually loaded down with books on popular science and the statistical analysis of sports.

Penelope came in third place in her first League, and she brought her cute little brother Calvin along this year to show him the ropes. She likes to excel in everything she does, from schoolwork to her favorite hobby, horseback riding.

Rika is an avid card collector as well as a skilled tournament player. She made the Pokémon World Championships last year, and she likes to analyze games once they’re over, always striving to improve. Rika has full sets of several expansions in Japanese, and she writes poetry in her spare time.

Tyson has been friends with Mick and Grayson for ages, and though he's competitive, they make him look laid-back. He joined the League when Ali did, to try to impress her, and he has gotten really into it since. He just got his driver's license and wants to buy a super-fast convertible someday.

Zach got his job at the game store through Ella. Enthusiastic but a little hapless, he loves the Pokémon TCG and reading fantasy novels. His favorite part of his job is helping new players get acquainted with the store's regulars.

Ali is best friends with Brittney and usually enjoys having Juji around...unless she's being annoying! Brittney taught her to play the Pokémon TCG some time ago, but she's only really gotten into it recently. She's also into fortune-telling, so she's handy with cards. Her shuffle is a sight to see!
Brittney likes to act and sing in school plays, and she dabbles in photography. She likes to take pictures of flowers and animals. She is best friends with Ali...unless they are playing Pokémon!

Don't let Calvin's nervous demeanor fool you. His sister Penelope placed third last year, and she's taught him all her tricks. Besides playing the Pokémon TCG, his favorite things are reading poetry and playing cribbage. Don't count him out just because he's new to the game!

Cammie likes reading and hanging out with her science club pals. What she really loves, though, is destroying her brother Grayson (or anyone else who's handy) at Pokémon. She's come in first in several Leagues, and she is playing odd decks just to feel challenged again.

Daniel has been playing the Pokémon TCG competitively since he was 12. He's attended the World Championships several times, and he placed 61st one year. Though he's pursuing a Ph.D. in political science, he still takes time out to practice the violin…and play Pokémon.

Ella's parents own a game store and encouraged her love of TCGs. She now works with Zach at her parents' store, running Leagues and teaching kids to do magic tricks. She's proud of how many of her store's regulars have gone on to win big tournaments, but is also a little envious.

Grayson shares a love of cars (especially hot rods) with his League friends Mick and Tyson. He's a student at a local college. He's been playing Pokémon since it first came out and is a formidable opponent...though not as formidable as his sister, Cammie.

Baking and drawing are Juji's favorite hobbies. She worships Brittney and Ali, and wants to become a competitive Pokémon player. Beneath a veneer of timidity, she burns with a need to prove that she's not just a wilting flower.

Kendall isn't just a skilled TCG player—she's also a successful Mathlete who loves statistics, manga, and electronic music. When she goes to tournaments, she can often be found playing Pokémon games on her Nintendo DS system between rounds.

Logan used to collect Pokémon cards when he was younger, and recently he got into playing the game. He's always confident of victory, even when things aren't going his way. When he's not playing cards, he's training to become a park ranger.

Mick has been League Champion several times, and he just can't imagine his friends Tyson and Grayson will ever beat him! He's into mixed martial arts and is taking boxing classes at a local gym. When he's not working out, he likes talking about cars with Tyson and Grayson.

Nathan is originally from Winnipeg, Canada. When he's not playing Pokémon, you can find him on the ice playing hockey. He also came in second in his school's spelling bee. He loves to trade cards, and he aims to collect one of every card available!

Otis is a latecomer to the Pokémon TCG, but after joining up with Daniel and Rika, he's become a force to be reckoned with.  He's a man of few words, but he regularly attends football games and his backpack is usually loaded down with books on popular science and the statistical analysis of sports.

Penelope came in third place in her first League, and she brought her cute little brother Calvin along this year to show him the ropes. She likes to excel in everything she does, from schoolwork to her favorite hobby, horseback riding.

Rika is an avid card collector as well as a skilled tournament player. She made the Pokémon World Championships last year, and she likes to analyze games once they’re over, always striving to improve. Rika has full sets of several expansions in Japanese, and she writes poetry in her spare time.

Tyson has been friends with Mick and Grayson for ages, and though he's competitive, they make him look laid-back. He joined the League when Ali did, to try to impress her, and he has gotten really into it since. He just got his driver's license, and wants to buy a super-fast convertible someday.

Zach got his job at the game store through Ella. Enthusiastic but a little hapless, he loves the Pokémon TCG and reading fantasy novels. His favorite part of his job is helping new players get acquainted with the store's regulars.

fte.deckbuilderinstructions.message1: Welcome to the Deck Manager. Let me teach you how to build a new deck!

fte.deckunlock.0zach: Wowza! Nice job defeating all those Trainers.

fte.firstinstructionalcomplete.ellamessa: Now that you know the basics, I'm going to teach you some more advanced rules.
fte.firstpcdredemption.2zach: You can use it in the Theme Deck game mode, or use the cards to build decks.
fte.firstpcdredemption.3zach: Come back soon and redeem some more decks with Trainer Tokens or Gems.
fte.firstpcdredemption.title: Theme Deck Redemption
fte.firsttctransition.zachintro: Now that you know how to play, you can try your skills in the Trainer Challenge! Since you're new, you'll start out in the Gold League.

fte.firstwin.3zach: After you beat a Trainer, your next opponent will become available.

fte.firstwin.5ella: Win 8 different matches with the same deck, and Zach will give you those cards for your Collection!

fte.pvpinstructions.message1: In Versus Mode, you can practice against the AI or play against other players. Go ahead and play a Random Battle to check it out!
fte.pvpinstructions.message2: Next you should select Practice. After you play 5 practice games, you'll unlock Ranked.
fte.pvpinstructions.message3: Finally, choose your deck. You can even choose your new Basic Orange deck!
fte.secondwin.ella1: Epic win! Here are three more achievements that you can earn as you play!
fte.secondwin.ella2: It's super effective...or at least this achievement is. Deal 100 damage with a single attack to earn this badge!
fte.secondwin.ella3: Every Trainer must be effective with every type! Win one game in the Trainer Challenge with each of the Basic decks: Red, Green, and Blue. Then you'll be well on your way.
fte.secondwin.ella4: It's time to show off your style! Customize your avatar to earn the All Dressed Up achievement. Not only will you look good, but you'll have a badge to prove it!
fte.secondwin.ella5: There are tons of achievements to earn! Check out your profile page to see what you've earned and what other badges you can achieve!
fte.secondwin.ella6a: If you earn all three achievements, I'll give you a special coin.
fte.secondwin.ella6b: Looks like you already have some of these achievements. If you earn the rest, I'll give you a special coin.
fte.secondwin.title: Your Second Win!
fte.trainerchallenge.loss: That was a tough game! Some decks are weak to other decks. See if you want to change your deck, and then play again!
fte.trainerchallenge.message1: Pick your deck to challenge me!
fte.trainerchallenge.message2: Great game! Looks like Mick is ready to battle. Good luck!
fte.trainerchallenge.message3: You're doing really well. You can continue in the Trainer Challenge or play against other players in Versus Mode.
